name: RocketLit
headline: RocketLit is an adaptive learning and assessment platform.
description:
RocketLit gives all students better access to learning and educators access to the data they need to be most impactful.

Our first product, RocketLit, is an adaptive and personalized learning platform that serves reading to students at their independent level. Students read the same content at different levels of complexity and fluidly move up reading levels as they improve.

InnerOrbit is our new Science Assessment platform, giving students, teachers and administrators the practice and data they need to be successful on science tests. We serve the highest quality content and feature the most detailed reporting on the market. 

We’re a small and focused team working to change the world through science education. Our company has served over 650k students and we’re on track to more than double that number in the next year. We’re looking for folks who’ll grow into a leadership role within the organization.

founders.name: Brendan Finch, Founder/CEO
founders.description: Veteran teacher working tirelessly to support admin, teachers, and students with digital learning through our leveled reading and NGSS Assessment products.

raw_markdown="![](http://www.rocketlit.com/_images/_structure/icons/icon_navigation-hamburger.png) ![](http://www.rocketlit.com/_images/_structure/icons/icon_navigation-close.png)
[![](https://www.rocketlit.com/_images/_structure/icon_rocketlit_twitter.png)](http://www.rocketlit.com/<https:/twitter.com/rocketlitreads>) [![](https://www.rocketlit.com/_images/_structure/icon_rocketlit_facebook.png)](http://www.rocketlit.com/<https:/www.facebook.com/rocketlit>) [![](https://www.rocketlit.com/_images/_structure/icon_rocketlit_pinterest.png)](http://www.rocketlit.com/<http:/www.pinterest.com/birdbrainedu>) [![](https://www.rocketlit.com/_images/_structure/icon_rocketlit_you-tube.png)](http://www.rocketlit.com/<https:/www.youtube.com/channel/UCfRU7LKdqfr06JQ2do_no9Q>)

Sign Up Log in

  * [Pilot](http://www.rocketlit.com/</signup/pilot.php>)
  * [Articles](http://www.rocketlit.com/</articles>)
  * [Explore](http://www.rocketlit.com/</explore/features/>)
X
## Explore
![](http://www.rocketlit.com/_images/logos/rocketlit/logo_rocketlit-icon.png)
### Standards Alignment
    * [NGSS](http://www.rocketlit.com/<https:/www.rocketlit.com/explore/standards-alignment/science/ngss-next-generation-science-standards.php>)
    * [TEKS for Texas](http://www.rocketlit.com/<https:/www.rocketlit.com/explore/standards-alignment/science/teks-texas-essential-knowledge-and-skills.php>)
    * [NGSSS for Florida ](http://www.rocketlit.com/<https:/www.rocketlit.com/explore/standards-alignment/science/ngsss-florida-next-generation-sunshine-state-standards.php>)
    * [NCES for North Carolina](http://www.rocketlit.com/<https:/www.rocketlit.com/explore/standards-alignment/science/nces-north-carolina-essential-standards.php>)
### Assets
    * [Sharing Us with Others](http://www.rocketlit.com/<https:/www.rocketlit.com/explore/assets/sharing-with-other-teachers.php>)
    * [EdCamp Sponsorships](http://www.rocketlit.com/<https:/www.rocketlit.com/explore/assets/edcamp-sponsorship.php>)
### Implementation
    * [For Middle Schools ](http://www.rocketlit.com/<https:/www.rocketlit.com/explore/implementation/leveled-readings-for-middle-school-students.php>)
    * [For Homeschools](http://www.rocketlit.com/<https:/www.rocketlit.com/explore/implementation/affordable-app-for-homeschools.php>)
    * [For English Language Learners](http://www.rocketlit.com/<https:/www.rocketlit.com/explore/implementation/app-for-english-language-learners.php>)
### Features
    * [Leveled Assignments](http://www.rocketlit.com/<https:/www.rocketlit.com/explore/features/leveled-assignments-and-differentiated-reading.php>)
    * [Annotations & Highlighting](http://www.rocketlit.com/<https:/www.rocketlit.com/explore/features/annotations-and-highlighting.php>)
    * [Articles Read Aloud](http://www.rocketlit.com/<https:/www.rocketlit.com/explore/features/articles-read-aloud.php>)
    * [Printable Articles](http://www.rocketlit.com/<https:/www.rocketlit.com/explore/features/printable-articles.php>)
### Useful Reports
    * [Reteach & Vocabulary](http://www.rocketlit.com/<https:/www.rocketlit.com/explore/reports/reteach-report-by-core-concepts.php>)
    * [Shareable School Report](http://www.rocketlit.com/<https:/www.rocketlit.com/explore/reports/shareable-school-report.php>)
  * [Pricing](http://www.rocketlit.com/</store>)
  * [Support](http://www.rocketlit.com/</support>)


![](http://www.rocketlit.com/_images/logos/rocketlit/logo_rocketlit_dropshadow.png)
# Education tailored and adapted to each student's reading level
Teachers, Sign Up Free
1
Save Time on Lesson Planning
2
Instantly Differentiate
3
Reach Every Student
4
Know What to Reteach
![](http://www.rocketlit.com/_images/_structure/icons/icon_stacked-books.png)
## Reading LevelsDiagnosed
We figure out what your students need and personalize reading to each student's own reading level.
![](http://www.rocketlit.com/_images/_structure/icons/icon_owl-face.png)
## AdaptiveReading
As comprehension improves, we constantly adapt student reading levels by moving each student up and down when they're ready.
![](http://www.rocketlit.com/_images/_structure/icons/icon_checklist.png)
## Engaging Curriculum Based on Standards
Find tons of NGSS aligned non-fiction in one place, written in a fun voice students love, filled with analogies they can grasp.
![](http://www.rocketlit.com/_images/tablet-top_diagnostics.png)
### Students Start with Diagnostics
Your students read three short articles, each followed by a quiz. This sets their initial reading level for upcoming assignments.
![](http://www.rocketlit.com/_images/tablet-top_leveled.png)
### Students Always Read Articles at Their Current Reading Level
After reading, your students take a multiple choice quiz and their reading level adapts based on how well they do.
![](http://www.rocketlit.com/_images/tablet-top_annotations.png)
### Annotations and Highlighting
Students can highlight, circle, and underline text then attach their own notes for teachers to look over.
![](http://www.rocketlit.com/_images/tablet-top_freeresponse.png)
### Free Response Questions
These come at the end of a quiz, right after the multiple choice section, and can be turned on or off for any assignment.
![](http://www.rocketlit.com/_images/tablet-top_readspeaker.png)
### Articles Read Aloud and Highlighted
Students at lower reading levels or those who need to can listen to the article while following along as text is highlighted.
![](http://www.rocketlit.com/_images/_structure/icons/icon_speaker.png)
![](http://www.rocketlit.com/_images/tablet-top_recent-scores_black.png)
### Receive Reports to Inform Future Instruction
Quickly see what vocabulary words students struggled with to help you focus on reteaching troublesome concepts.
![](http://www.rocketlit.com/_images/tablet-top_ngss-aligned.png) ![](http://www.rocketlit.com/_images/tablet-top_ngss-background.png)
### Easily Assign NGSS Aligned Articles
Sort articles by NGSS Performance Expectations or Cross-Cutting Concepts. You can also browse by unit or search for specific terms.
![](http://www.rocketlit.com/_images/tablet-top_gradebook.png)
### More than a Gradebook
Use our gradebook to see how students improve over time or with retries. You can calculate averages on the fly as well as export all of your data.
![](http://www.rocketlit.com/_images/paper-top_earthquakes.png) ![](http://www.rocketlit.com/_images/paper-top_gravity.png) ![](http://www.rocketlit.com/_images/paper-top_food-chain.png)
### Print All Reading Levels
We have print-optimized PDF versions of every article for every reading level. Symbols mark each reading level so you know who gets which version. 
![](http://www.rocketlit.com/_images/tablet-top_shareable-reports.png)
### Shareable Reports
Easily shareable reports let you give coaches and admin digestible visual data about how your students are progressing.
## Experience
#### as a student
  * Reading Level Diagnostic
  * Leveled Assignments
  * Annotations and Highlighting
  * Free Response Questions
  * Articles Read Aloud


#### as a teacher
  * Reports to Inform Instruction
  * Easily Assign for NGSS
  * Exportable Gradebook
  * Printable Articles
  * Shareable Reports


## Teachers, get a free one month trial!
Get RocketLit Science and History for use in your classroom for one month, absolutely free.
Get Started
## What Educators Say
![](http://www.rocketlit.com/_images/people/teachers/joanne-salustri.jpg)
Joanne Salustri
7th & 8th GradeScience
It’s a resource students have been motivated to read because the articles are interesting and well-written. It is rewarding to see that after reading the articles and taking the free response questions, they do understand the concepts.
St. Patrick's School
Huntington, NY
![](http://www.rocketlit.com/_images/people/teachers/corbin-rice.jpg)
Corbin Rice
6th Grade Science
The platform’s ease of use and intuitive design drew me in, but the differentiation piece is really the seller. I can look up a million articles on everything on my own, but the website already does it all for me.
Northeast Middle School
Minneapolis, MN
![](http://www.rocketlit.com/_images/people/teachers/beth-donoghue.jpg)
Beth Donoghue
6th Grade Science & Social Studies
Finding leveled reading resources with the same concepts had been a struggle, so I love how RocketLit articles are leveled for individual reading levels, but still have common examples and vocabulary we could discuss as a class.
Chippewa Middle School
Des Plaines, IL
![](http://www.rocketlit.com/_images/people/teachers/chad-ledune.jpg)
Chad Ledune
Middle School Science
Even my most gifted students have voiced their opinions on how challenging RocketLit is. Which, as a teacher, is something that I appreciate about the product. Many of my students are reading at the 11-12th grade level. 
Sullivan Middle School
St. Carlisle, IN
## Just A Few of our Awesome Learning Partners
![](http://www.rocketlit.com/_images/logos/logo_kipp-bay-area.png) ![](http://www.rocketlit.com/_images/logos/oak-grove-school-district.jpg) ![](http://www.rocketlit.com/_images/logos/logo_rocketship.png) ![](http://www.rocketlit.com/_images/logos/logo_kipp-houston.png)
## More than 1,000,000teacher hours saved
### Finding suitable text and scoring quizzes
# Free for the first month, then as little as $4 a student thereafter
Try RocketLit Now
![](http://www.rocketlit.com/_images/people/brendan-finch.jpg)
### Born in the classroom,
### Created by a teacher
_Brendan Finch, Founder_
#### Featured in:
![](http://www.rocketlit.com/_images/logos/logo_forbes.png) ![](http://www.rocketlit.com/_images/logos/logo_the-huffington-post.png) ![](http://www.rocketlit.com/_images/logos/logo_the-daily-dot.png)
  * [Home](http://www.rocketlit.com/</>)
  * [Science Articles](http://www.rocketlit.com/</articles>)
  * [History Articles](http://www.rocketlit.com/</articles>)
  * [Get an Account](http://www.rocketlit.com/<#>)
  * [Pricing](http://www.rocketlit.com/</store>)
  * [District Pilots](http://www.rocketlit.com/</signup/pilot.php>)
  * [Support](http://www.rocketlit.com/</support>)


  * [NGSS Articles](http://www.rocketlit.com/</articles/?standards=ngss>)
  * [NGSS Assessment](http://www.rocketlit.com/<https:/www.innerorbit.com>)
  * [TEKS Articles](http://www.rocketlit.com/</articles/?standards=teks>)
  * [NGSSS Florida Articles](http://www.rocketlit.com/</articles/?standards=ngsss>)
  * [NCES Articles](http://www.rocketlit.com/</articles/?standards=nces>)

generated_description:
### Snapshot of RocketLit

**Overview**

RocketLit, founded in 2016 and a proud participant in Y Combinator's S16 batch, is an innovative edtech company based in Santa Monica, California. With a compact team of 11 dedicated employees, RocketLit’s mission is to enhance access to learning for students and provide educators with actionable data to maximize their impact.

**Key Offerings**

1. **RocketLit Platform**: As the company’s flagship product, RocketLit is an adaptive learning platform that tailors reading content to individual student levels. It allows students to engage with the same material but at varying complexities, adapting dynamically as their skills improve.

2. **InnerOrbit**: This newly launched science assessment platform complements RocketLit by equipping educators and students with essential practice tools and comprehensive reporting. InnerOrbit focuses on preparing users for science tests, providing high-quality content, and detailed performance analytics.

**Impact**

RocketLit prides itself on its significant outreach, having served over 650,000 students with plans to double that within the next year. Their products not only save teachers valuable time but also help in directing instruction effectively. They are actively on the hunt for talented individuals who aspire to take on leadership roles within the organization.

**Features of RocketLit:**
- **Leveled Assignments**: Customized reading tasks tailored to each student’s ability.
- **Annotations & Highlighting**: Encourages active reading through interactive tools.
- **Read-Aloud Options**: Accessibility for lower reading levels to hear content as they follow along.
- **Detailed Reporting**: Facilitates educators in understanding student progress and areas needing attention.

**Market Positioning**

Aligning with educational standards like NGSS, TEKS, and others, RocketLit stands out in the crowded edtech space. Their focus on adaptive learning positions them well amidst rising trends in personalized education, making them an attractive option for schools aiming to implement differentiated learning strategies.

**Trial Offer**

RocketLit believes in their product so much that they offer educators a free month-long trial to explore the benefits of their platform.

**Engagement Channels**

Interested parties can find RocketLit on social media platforms such as Twitter, Facebook, and YouTube to stay updated and witness their ongoing contributions to education.

**Conclusion**

In the ever-evolving landscape of education technology, RocketLit emerges as a compelling player with its promise of personalized learning experiences and data-driven insights. If you're involved in education—be it as a teacher, administrator, or learner—you might want to take a closer look at what RocketLit has to offer. You can check them out at [RocketLit.com](http://www.rocketlit.com).
